title: Lee Sin needs a major nerf
body:
I'm sure Lee Sin mains will down vote this, but it needs to be said, Lee is at the point of being stupidly OP now. 

He is the most mobile champ in the game and doesn't pay for that HUGE advantage anywhere in his kit. He does very good damage, if he just builds one damage item. He is extremely tanky, even without items, add in his ridiculously easy escapes and he is realistically one of the hardest champs in the game to kill. His jungle clears are fast and safe. His ganks are very good as well. Lee literally has no weakness at all in his gameplay currently. 

I'm sure people will immediately jump on the "he falls off late" bandwagon. The thing is, he really doesn't. By late they mean post 50 minutes, and even then he is still quite good from his utility alone. 

UPDATE: Still hearing only crickets from Riot when it comes to actual balance on Lee. 

Then there is the "he's very hard to play at that level" crowd. Yes, he is one of the hardest champs to master mechanically. However, he is so OP at this point that you don't even have to be good with him to carry at 90% of the ELOs. Just watch a Bronze player with 10 or more games on him and that argument goes straight out the window. 

Finally you will hear the "he just got nerfed not too long ago". They lowered the damage on his ult. This pretty much had zero effect on his gameplay. Not a single person plays Lee for his ult damage. It was once again a joke nerf from Riot that does nothing to effect the actual health of the champion. (Another great example would be the last "nerf" to Ahri). 

So Riot, grow a set of balls and actually nerf Lee Sin. He is at a point where you could literally lower his damage 50% across all of his abilities and he would still be a viable champ.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Rumble has no mobility other than a (very) slight speed buff for half a second, and he pops like a balloon. 

Vlad's mobility is only when he has stacks of bloodthirst, (and it barely buffs his speed) and his W, which is on a stupidly high cooldown. Not to mention how worthless he is early, and how disgusting he is in late.

-------------------------------------------------------------

Characters like Yasuo, Lee, Riven, and Zed have more mobility than anyone else in the game, but it comes at no real cost.

There's nothing inherently wrong with energy, but mobility cannot and should not be free.
